snippet: At least twice in recent years, Beijing has sought to explore the South China Sea but backed down after protests by Vietnam. That good will evaporated this week.
abstract: China inflames tensions with Vietnam by moving its first deepwater drilling rig to position about 17 miles off an island claimed by both countries in South China Sea; move signals that China is more willing to act first and invite diplomacy later in dealing with territorial claims.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Reporting was contributed by Mike Ives from Hanoi, Vietnam, and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: At least twice in recent years, Beijing has sought to explore the South China Sea but backed down after protests by Vietnam. That good will evaporated this week.

headline.main: In High Seas, China Moves Unilaterally
headline.print_headline: In High Seas, China Moves Unilaterally
